Large/iterative authentication requests.Action: Collect failed authentication logs (Windows Event ID 4625) and Zeek conn.log for public-facing services. Group logs by source IP and destination service. Calculate the number of failed attempts per source IP per unit of time. Identify IPs with a high rate of failed attempts or iterative attempts against multiple user accounts/emails. Use correlation analysis to link failed attempts across different public services from the same source.

Unusual external network traffic pattern.Action: Monitor Zeek conn.log and http.log for external traffic targeting public-facing web servers. Analyze patterns in connection volume and request frequency from source IPs. Identify IPs exhibiting high connection volumes or request rates inconsistent with normal user browsing (e.g., using descriptive statistics, IQR, or time series analysis on connection/request rates per source IP). Look for anomalous User-Agent strings or Referer headers in http.log.

Automated or high-volume web requests fr.Action: Monitor Zeek http.log for external requests targeting predictable URL paths related to user profiles, contact lists, or directories on public-facing corporate websites (e.g., /users/, /contact/, /employee-directory). Identify source IPs with high request rates or those accessing a large number of distinct paths. Use frequency analysis and descriptive statistics to establish baseline traffic patterns and flag significant outliers in request volume per source IP/user agent.

Repeated attempts to query public-facing.Action: Monitor Zeek http.log for connections to known public API endpoints associated with authentication or user enumeration (e.g., Office 365 Autodiscover, GetCredentialType endpoints). Analyze request parameters or URLs for iterative patterns indicative of probing different usernames or email formats. Correlate with Windows Event ID 4625 on relevant servers for failed authentication attempts originating from these API interactions. Use correlation analysis to identify source IPs making iterative queries across various potential user identifiers and flag those exceeding a threshold.
